There are five pieces with print, the old shop window, two tiles with &ldquo;LION HOUSE&rdquo; and in Danish &ldquo;L&Oslash;VEHUSET&rdquo; and the tile with the patent application and a panel with the LEGO Group&rsquo;s motto.</p>\r\n\r\n<p>We vision the set coming with an additional booklet with pictures and text from the LEGO archives about the history of the company and the house.</p>\r\n\r\n<p>The LION House can be seen as the core of the LEGO brand, the place where it all started.</p>\r\n\r\n<p>Ole Kirk Christiansen started with wooden toys in this house and his son Godtfred took over in the same place with producing the plastic bricks we now know and come to love.<br />\r\nHere is your chance to own a model of this piece of LEGO history.</p>\r\n", I hope this creation will become a LEGO set till the next jubilee.</p>\r\n\r\n<p><strong><em>My favorites</em></strong>&nbsp; Lego pirates is my favorite series, that&rsquo;s why I created my own version of a ship with 3 masts and 10 guns. I understand it&rsquo;s a beginning, a concept which can evolve thanks to your advice and become a set on shelves. My ship needs to be longer. If LEGO designers &nbsp;add hull sections to make a ship longer it would give more spacing between masts which will really give it a better look. LEGO always gives twice as less guns as gun ports. I improved that as many fans like it. My ship is based on a combination of Skull&rsquo;s Eye Schooner 6285 (1993) and Emperor&rsquo;s Ship 7416 (2003). All my gun ports are classic pirate flags.</p>\r\n\r\n<p><strong><em>The main idea</em></strong>&nbsp; The Pirates series once included lots of ships but none had 3 masts. I used mostly big LEGO bricks to make it medium difficult to build. Besides people of all ages love pirate ships, children, men and women alike, all over the world. It can cost less than $200. The deck is removable and there is a large cannon deck. The set includes only 2 mini figures &ndash; the captain (series 14) and a classic pirate monkey in a crow&rsquo;s nest because I&rsquo;d like to know what mini figures my fans would like in his crew. I gave white epaulets to the captain because they were the most rare before 2014 and historically meant the highest rank, golden for officers and red or blue for privates. Comments, criticism and suggestions are welcome.&nbsp; But for it to appear on the horizon in the endless sea of LEGO sets it needs 10000 supporters. Please feel free to comment for me to know which aspects you&rsquo;d like to see in the updates.</p>\r\n\r\n<p>&nbsp;There are additional weapons. I think many LEGO fans don&rsquo;t like it that some sets often have fewer weapons than mini figures. There is a crane for treasure chests on a mast. It rotates and can move up and down.&nbsp;These things increase playability and help your fantasy to create plenty of stories.&nbsp;Designing sails LEGO teams often use Lego skulls and bones. I like that idea very much. But in my project the sails are red and skulls black as in Queen Ann&rsquo;s Revenge (4195). The deck and captain&rsquo;s cabin are removable and you can easily look inside and hide treasure there. All the masts have shrouds to get to crows&rsquo; nests. I always try to be attentive to such details.</p>\r\n\r\n<p><strong><em>Interesting details</em></strong>: I used Ursula a Disney mini figure 2016 as a bow figure. You can easily look inside the captain&rsquo;s cabin from the stern. The captain&rsquo;s cabin has doors to the deck and to the stern.</p>\r\n\r\n<p>&nbsp;I tried to represent a quarter of a century of LEGO ships in one single project. Robot</strong>, <strong>Tom Servo</strong>, and <strong>Cambot</strong>.&nbsp;&nbsp;Crow and Tom Servo join Joel and Mike in the theater where they are forced to watch terrible movies, all the while subjecting viewers to fits of laughter as they ridicule the film with hilarious commentary.&nbsp; The lead antagonists <strong>Dr. Clayton Forrester </strong>and <strong>TV&#39;s Frank</strong> regularly send these terrible movies in their quest for world domination and their&nbsp;experiment to determine how watching bad movies will affect a person&#39;s mind, while <strong>Pearl Forrester</strong>, the <strong>Observer</strong>, and <strong>Professor Bobo </strong>continue the tradition in the later seasons.&nbsp; The witty and original show brought to light a new genre of comedy that impacted and inspired thousands of people, and brought back otherwise lifeless movies and made them worth watching with hilarious commentary.&nbsp; Now, years later the show is coming back with 14 brand new episodes planned to release in 2016.&nbsp; As MST3K fans gear up for the reboot, why not watch it with the beloved cast of the original MST3K and the Satellite of Love - in Lego form!</p>\r\n\r\n<p>The Lego Satellite of Love features:</p>\r\n\r\n<ul>\r\n\t<li>The main characters from MST3K including Joel Robinson, Mike Nelson, Crow T. Robot, Tom Servo, Gypsy, Cambot, Dr. Clayton Forrester, TV&#39;s Frank, Pearl Forrester, the Observer, and Professor Bobo.</li>\r\n\t<li>The series of six doors&nbsp;are included down the top shaft of the doggy-bone shaped ship, they are fully functional and the top is removable so you can open and close them yourself when movie sign activates!</li>\r\n\t<li>The two classic rooms:&nbsp; The front top sphere is the bridge where the host segments are carried out, this includes invention exchanges and comedy routines between breaks in the movie.&nbsp; The second room in the back top sphere is the Mystery Science Theater itself, where Joel, Mike, and the Bots are forced to watch the B movies.&nbsp; Currently they are being entertained by the infamous <em>Manos: The Hands of Fate</em>.</li>\r\n\t<li>Two extra rooms:&nbsp; Though the lower two spheres are unexplained in the show, they have been fitted to include aspects of the show for this set.&nbsp; In the front bottom sphere is Deep 13, it&rsquo;s where Dr. Clayton Forrester and TV&#39;s Frank reside and send movies up to the Satellite of Love.&nbsp; The last room is in the back bottom sphere, within lies Castle Forrester where Pearl Forrester, the Observer, and Professor Bobo send movies up to the Satellite of Love for the last few seasons while advancing their goal to rule the world.</li>\r\n\t<li>The Lego Satellite of Love holds a sturdy design&nbsp;that meets the needs&nbsp;for both model display and play.</li>\r\n\t<li>It also has a very detailed exterior and interior design of all rooms; almost every aspect of this set is accurate to the show.</li>\r\n\t<li>All sides of each sphere are easily removable and re-attachable to allow space for play and viewing.&nbsp; Each sphere may be completely removed entirely if one wishes, remove the back of the theater room and place your phone behind it instead, this allows you to watch an MST3K episode on your phone along with your Lego characters.</li>\r\n</ul>\r\n\r\n<p>If you&rsquo;re wondering how they eat and breathe and other science facts, then repeat to yourself:&nbsp; It&rsquo;s a Lego set, you should really just These odd flat creatures, as the man explained, knew about left and right, back and forth, but didn&rsquo;t have a clue about up or down ... They did not know the third dimension, as we do. If one of them were to meet a three-dimensional being (an apple, say, who approached Flatland in a gesture of &quot;inter-dimensional amity&quot;), or if somehow the being pushed the flatlander from below and send him fluttering above the two dimensional world, the innocent flat creature would not understand anything. And afterwards, he would not know how to describe that mystical dimension called &quot;up&quot;.</span></p>\r\n\r\n<p><span lang=\"en-US\">And what about the fourth dimension? What about that place which is not left or right, front or back, up or down, but in another direction that we, normal people, cannot point at? Could we ever experience the same strange inter dimensional encounter, as the flatlander? </span></p>\r\n\r\n<p><span lang=\"en-US\">At that time I knew nothing about Science, but Carl Sagan&rsquo;s words fascinated me completely. And I have never forgotten that fascination. Carl Sagan&#39;s books occupy a place of honor in my library. </span></p>\r\n\r\n<p><span lang=\"en-US\">The set depicts the scene in which Carl talks about Flatland (a mathematical thought experiment designed by Edwin Abbott), which can be seen in <em>The Edge of Forever,</em> the original series 10</span><span lang=\"en-US\">th episode (</span>https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Mk4TkVNGwvk)<span lang=\"en-US\">. It includes a figure of Carl, along the desk and the elements of the explanation: the plane, the colorful cutouts that represent the Flatlanders, the apples and the glass cubes which are used to think about a four-dimensional cube, also called a hyper-cube or tesseract.</span></p>\r\n\r\n<p><span lang=\"en-US\">There is also a representation of the painting, &ldquo;Another world&rdquo;, by artist M.C. Escher, which is part of the original scene. I have to thank my wife Susan, who recognized the artist&#39;s work and helped me find it. This painting is very important, because it shows the paradox of seeing a landscape from different perspectives simultaneously. </span></p>\r\n\r\n<p><span lang=\"en-US\">Thank you for visiting and for reading! </span></p>\r\n\r\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\r\n\r\n<p><span>&ldquo;<span lang=\"en-US\">Imagination will often carry us to worlds that never were. Material for the part is fed into a heated barrel, mixed, and forced into a mould cavity, where it cools and hardens to the configuration of the cavity.<br />\r\n<br />\r\nThe model included :<br "product_image_tile_url": null, "title": "Arecibo Message", "state": {"name_short": "Gathering Support", "alias": "gathering_support"}, "stats_views_count": 330, "body": "<p>This is a faithful graphic representation of the Arecibo message, which was broadcast into space a single time via frequency modulated radio waves at a ceremony to mark the remodeling of the Arecibo radio telescope in Puerto Rico on 16 November 1974. The message was aimed at the current location of globular star cluster M13 some 25,000 light years away because M13 was a large and close collection of stars that was available in the sky at the time and place of the ceremony and its purpose is to communicate with possible extraterrestrial life forms. The message consists of seven parts that encode the following (from the top down):</p>\r\n\r\n<p><br />\r\n1.The numbers one (1) to ten (10) (white)<br />\r\n2.The atomic numbers of the elements hydrogen, carbon, nitrogen, oxygen, and phosphorus, which make up deoxyribonucleic acid (DNA) (purple)<br />\r\n3.The formulas for the sugars and bases in the nucleotides of DNA (green)<br />\r\n4.The number of nucleotides in DNA, and a graphic of the double helix structure of DNA (white &amp; blue)<br />\r\n5.A graphic figure of a human, the dimension (physical height) of an average man, and the human population of Earth (red, blue/white, &amp; white respectively)<br />\r\n6.A graphic of the Solar System indicating which of the planets the message is coming from (yellow)<br />\r\n7.A graphic of the Arecibo radio telescope and the dimension (the physical diameter) of the transmitting antenna dish (purple, white, &amp; blue).</p>\r\n\r\n<p><br />\r\nThis project is a must for any Lego collector interested in astronomy, science and sci-fi. The rooms are:</p>\r\n\r\n<ul>\r\n\t<li>A kitchen</li>\r\n\t<li>A dining room</li>\r\n\t<li>A sitting room</li>\r\n\t<li>Three bedrooms</li>\r\n\t<li>A bathroom</li>\r\n</ul>\r\n\r\n<p>As you can see from the pictures, the roof and top floor are easily removable for better playability and there are also stairs so that the minifigures can get from one floor to the other. There are four minifigures and a cat.</p>\r\n\r\n<p>There is also a car which fits in the garage. It includes:</p>\r\n\r\n<ul>\r\n\t<li>Opening doors</li>\r\n\t<li>Rear view mirrors</li>\r\n\t<li>A number plate at the back</li>\r\n\t<li>A gear&nbsp;stick</li>\r\n\t<li>A handbrake</li>\r\n\t<li>Space for four minifigures</li>\r\n</ul>\r\n\r\n<p>If you have any suggestions of what to add, leave a comment.</p>\r\n\r\n<p>If you like this project, you may like <a href=\"https://ideas.lego.com/profile/Camshaft/projects\">my other ones</a>. It has 6 sides like a normal Rubik&#39;s Cube, with the colors red, orange, white, yellow, green,&nbsp;and blue. There are only 3 possible scrambles for this puzzle, which makes it quite <strong>simple to solve</strong>. Good for <strong>all ages</strong>, especially children/teens, and a great, unique puzzle to add to your collection (most Rubik&#39;s Cube companies don&#39;t sell these). Support this project, and let&#39;s hope it reaches 10,000!</p>\r\n\r\n<p><strong>Here is the tutorial video:</strong></p>\r\n\r\n<p>https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xGlczj8XuGo</p>\r\n\r\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\r\n", "user_comments_locked": false, "tags": ["lego rubiks cube", "rubiks cube", "how to make a rubiks cube", "Rubik's Cube", "Lego Rubik's Cube", "how to make a Rubik's Cube", "how to make a lego Rubik's Cube", "lego rubiks cube 2x1", "lego rubiks cube 2x2x1", "2x2x1 lego rubiks cube", "2x2x1 rubiks cube", "2x2x1", "lego", "lego 2x2x1", "2x2x1 cube"], "state_entered_at": "2016-06-08T04:32:13.000Z", "user": {"alias": "RubiksWiiU", "id": 1088402, "uuid": "4d2f5a2e-1bc6-4719-a231-9117febee0f7"}, "product_image_url": null, "stats_followers_count_short": "27", "price_usd": null, "product_id": null, "stats_supporters_count_short": "98", "support_ending_at": "2017-06-08T04:32:13.000Z", "product_description": null, "published_at_formatted": "Jun 08, 2016", "image_url": "https://dp1eoqdp1qht7.cloudfront.net/community/projects/b4c/a67/143343/2487115-o_1akbl6v64ls11e4111b12tegca7-full.JPG", "state_id": 149, "stats_comments_count": 29, "stats_views_count_short": "1k"}, {"stats_days_left": 314.4391546233102, "updated_at": "2016-07-28T06:05:06.000Z", "image_tile_url": "https://dp1eoqdp1qht7.cloudfront.net/community/projects/054/a42/143686/2491927-o_1akk07va31juef57mn67o5esac-thumbnail-4GZuKNkHXfFXbQ.jpg", "stats_supporters_count": 30, "published_at": "2016-06-08T04:30:31.000Z", "sold_out": null, "stats_followers_count": 12, "stats_comments_count_short": "10", "id": 143686, "user_id": 1090028, "uuid": "a88da2c1-648e-438c-9357-35fb750e5b5a", "product_image_tile_url": null, "title": "Batman vs Harley Quinn", "state": {"name_short": "Gathering Support", "alias": "gathering_support"}, "stats_views_count": 242, "body": "<p>Cool! This is also very easy to travel with and play on the go.</p>\r\n\r\n<p>There are Four ways to play:</p>\r\n\r\n<p><em>Land Control</em>-Get each of your bricks on each opposing areas to win. You move by rolling a 6 sided die (1d6) and land on opposing bricks to make them go to the out cast island (green space).</p>\r\n\r\n<p><em>Conquer</em>-Get your king (rounded brick) to the opposite corner to win or if you jump on the other players king. If an opposing players piece is landed it&#39;s out of the game.</p>\r\n\r\n<p><em>Capture</em>-Same as conquer but if a piece gets jumped it just goes to the out cast island</p>\r\n\r\n<p><em>Kingdoms-</em>You have five actions a turn to destroy all the opposing kingdoms. "title": "BMW Z8 in Silver-red", "state": {"name_short": "Gathering Support", "alias": "gathering_support"}, "stats_views_count": 445, "body": "<p>The BMW Z8 is one of my favorite automobiles.&nbsp;&nbsp;When the Z07 prototype received strong attention and accolades at the 1997 Tokyo Auto Show, BMW knew that they had a hit.&nbsp; After a few modifications and relabeling it the Z8, the car was soon thereafter put into production and became an instant classic. &nbsp;BMW stopped making this&nbsp;car&nbsp;back in 2003 after building&nbsp;about 5,700 of them (including the Alpina), so you aren&#39;t going to see one very often.</p>\r\n\r\n<p>BMW offered only a very limited number of colors for the car. &nbsp;For the exterior, they produced silver, black, red, and blue, and eventually a darker metallic gray color. &nbsp;The interior could be ordered in black, red, red-black, tan, or tan-black. &nbsp;A BMW Individual version was eventually offered with more color choices.</p>\r\n\r\n<p>As with most sports cars, the Z8 with its nature-inspired curves&nbsp;poses a considerable challenge to reproduce faithfully in Lego. &nbsp;I have made an attempt here at 6 studs wide by ~20 studs long and ~5 studs high. &nbsp;The real vehicle is <span>72 in. wide,&nbsp;</span>173.2 in. long, and 51.9 in. high (ref: <a href=\"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/BMW_Z8\">https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/BMW_Z8</a>), so mine is a bit narrow (or long, if you prefer), due to limited part options. &nbsp;I implemented this model in silver (gray)&nbsp;with red interior. &nbsp;There was no suitable Lego color for the &quot;crema&quot; interior color BMW produced.&nbsp; Red and black exteriors also look good, but Lego does not produce a suitable shade of blue to match the blue exterior color of the car.</p>\r\n\r\n<p>If done as a full-blown model, I would add stickers for the BMW blue-and-white rondel on the hood (bonnet)&nbsp;and trunk (boot), and do the front grille as a sticker with highbeam lamps on the ends, applied to a gray curved piece rather than a black one.</p>\r\n\r\n<p>Henrik Fisker deserves a great deal of kudos for designing this beautiful automobile. &nbsp;I hope this model has done it justice.</p>\r\n", "user_comments_locked": false, "tags": ["car", "sports car", "Z8", "BMW"], friendly young dragon who lives in the colourful and fun world of LEGO!</strong></p>\r\n\r\n<p><strong>This model is challenging to build, yet satisfying.&nbsp;</strong>It is formed of mostly simple elements such as regular square/<span>rectangular&nbsp;</span>bricks and plates- no curves here!&nbsp;Another thing that&nbsp;sets this model apart is the <strong>hinged arms, wings, and mouth.</strong> These can be moved and posed manually, when younger children play with the model, but there is also&nbsp;the <strong>potential for the more experienced LEGO fan to add motors</strong> and program them to move as they wish! The inside of the model is therefore largely hollow, to aid with the addition of motors if desired, and to make it lighter.</p>\r\n\r\n<p>The design of Spike was inspired significantly by my recent trip to LEGOLAND Windsor, as I was amazed by the large-scale LEGO sculptures, built using mostly simple bricks to create a structure that is anything but simple. The house was known for a long time to be haunted by ghosts. (This is the story the Theme Park wants to tell, but the house was actually&nbsp;bought from ACME&nbsp;Theme Park Rides.)</p>\r\n\r\n<p>The ride includes two fake graves outside and a lot of special effects inside. The effects seem to be very scary, because the visitors at the top of the house&nbsp;have all turned ghastly&nbsp;pale.</p>\r\n\r\n<p>* * *</p>\r\n\r\n<p>I have always enjoyed the magic of theme parks and loved the different rides. Now I have combined this pleasure with my passion of LEGO construction in a project.</p>\r\n\r\n<p>I have used microscale to reduce the number of bricks needed, and to have a greater challenge in the designing process. It is&nbsp;fun to build different rides with just a&nbsp;small&nbsp;amount of bricks.</p>\r\n\r\n<p>All the sets are constructed on 16x16 base plates which you can snap&nbsp;together to create a large Theme Park. The&nbsp;base plates&nbsp;can easily be parted&nbsp;again and reshuffled to create a new park.</p>\r\n\r\n<p>I have added a picture with ten Theme Park units&nbsp;put together, so you can see an example of a Theme Park. All&nbsp;ten parts have now been posted here so please feel free to support them all!</p>\r\n\r\n<p>My earlier parts are found here:</p>\r\n\r\n<p>Octopus ride: <a href=\"https://ideas.lego.com/projects/139452\" target=\"_blank\">https://ideas.lego.com/projects/139452</a></p>\r\n\r\n<p>Merry-Go-Around: <a href=\"https://ideas.lego.com/projects/139940\" target=\"_blank\">https://ideas.lego.com/projects/139940</a></p>\r\n\r\n<p>Observation Tower (<strong>updated</strong>): <a href=\"https://ideas.lego.com/projects/140355\" It is is claimed to be the largest water wheel in Europe: possibly in the world.<br />\r\nIt was built in 1854 to pump water from the workings of the Great Laxey Mining Company. Mining was of considerable importance to the economy of Laxey and the Great Laxey Mine was one of the major producers of lead and zinc in the British Isles.<br />\r\nThe Laxey water wheel was designed by the local engineer Robert Casement. The official opening of took place in September 1854 and it was set in motion by the Honourable Charles Hope, the Lieutenant Governor of the Island. The wheel was named &quot;Lady Isabella&quot; in honour of the Governor&#39;s wife.<br />\r\nThe wheel has a diameter of 72 feet 6 inches, (over 22 metres), and a width of 6 feet. It is capable of pumping 250 gallons of water per minute from a depth of almost 1,500 feet. The mine shaft from which the water was pumped was sited about 450 yards from the great wheel. The power from the wheel was transmitted to the pumping mechanism by a series of rods supported by and running along an imposing masonry viaduct.</p>\r\n\r\n<p><br />\r\n<strong>About the Isle of Man</strong><br />\r\nThe Isle of Man is a self-governing crown dependency in the Irish Sea between Great Britain and Ireland. The head of state is Queen Elizabeth II, who holds the title of Lord of Mann. The Lord of Mann is represented by a Lieutenant Governor. The island has its&rsquo; own government &ndash; the Tynwald.<br />\r\nThe island is well known for its&rsquo; annual TT Motorcycle race and the native &lsquo;Manx&rsquo; cat which has no tail (it can actually be a very short stumpy tail or none at all).<br />\r\n<strong>Decoration</strong> - The decorated disc on the end of the model and the two flags would carry the Isle of Man (Manx) emblem &ndash;
